intro: Lophanthus pinetorum, commonly known as the pineleaf lophanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble pine needles. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
